newsitem.title: UK: U.K. to boost export credits for Russia.
newsitem.headline: U.K. to boost export credits for Russia.

text.p: Britain said on Monday it would provide a further 250 million stg in export credits to Russia, to be made available once the International Monetary Fund resumes lending there.

"The provision of these new export credits reflects the improvement in Russia's political and economic situation over the past four years or so," President of the Board of Trade Ian Lang said in a statement.
The amount, to be provided by the Export Credits Guarantee Department, is on top of the $800 million ($ is correct) pledged over three years ago and which is almost exhausted.
The new credits will be available to support Russian projects which require the supply of British capital and semi-capital goods and services.
Sales of defence related equipment are specifically excluded.
